text: {{Infobox writer | name = Herman Wouk | image = Famous writer Herman Wouk arrived in Israel (FL45728797).jpg | imagesize = | caption = Wouk in 1972 | birth_date = | birth_place = The Bronx, New York, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = Palm Springs, California, U.S. | resting_place = Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, New York, U.S. | occupation = Author | education = Townsend Harris High School | alma_mater = Columbia University | period = 1941–2015 | genre = | subject = | movement = | spouse = | children = 3 | relatives = Victor Wouk (brother) | signature = | module = | website = | notableworks = | footnotes = }} Herman Wouk (May 27, 1915 – May 17, 2019) was a Pulitzer Prize winning American writer. He was from New York City, New York. Wouk had written many books including The Caine Mutiny. He won Pulitzer Prize award in 1952.Twin Imaging Technology preserves personal journals for Pulitzer Prize author, Herman Wouk . Wouk was Orthodox Jewish. He was known for his defence of religion, tradition, American patriotism and the Military. Wouk died in his sleep at his home in Palm Springs, California on May 17, 2019, ten days before his 104th birthday.'Caine Mutiny,' 'Winds of War' author Herman Wouk has died ==References== ==Other websites== *"Books: The Wouk Mutiny", Time Magazine cover story, September 5, 1955 * Columbia 250: Herman Wouk *Herman Wouk Papers * Category:1915 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:American novelists Category:Jewish American writers Category:Pulitzer Prize winners Category:Writers from New York City
